trans-unit.source: A collection of <xref href="System.Web.Security.MembershipUser"></xref> objects.

A <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection?displayProperty=fullName> is returned from the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.GetAllUsers%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.FindUsersByName%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.FindUsersByEmail%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership?displayProperty=fullName> class.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection> objects returned by the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.GetAllUsers%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.FindUsersByName%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.FindUsersByEmail%2A> methods contain a snapshot of user information in the membership data store.
That is, changes to the membership user information in a <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection> are not reflected in the membership data store.

To modify membership user information in the membership data store, use the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.UpdateUser%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.DeleteUser%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership?displayProperty=fullName> class.
If you are not familiar with the membership features of ASP.NET, see [Introduction to Membership](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/79184d17-f4c7-4c9f-a073-cec4f5543980) before continuing.
For a list of other topics related to membership, see [Managing Users by Using Membership](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/824c3a24-f0af-427c-a652-0d2d1e9397cd).
Creates a new, empty membership user collection.

A <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection> is constructed by membership provider implementers and returned from the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.GetAllUsers%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.FindUsersByName%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider> abstract class.
Adds the specified membership user to the collection.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection.Add%2A> method is commonly used by membership provider implementations of the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.GetAllUsers%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.FindUsersByEmail%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.FindUsersByName%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider> abstract class.
A <xref href="System.Web.Security.MembershipUser"></xref> object to add to the collection.
The collection is read-only.
The of the user is null.
A object with the same value as user already exists in the collection.
Removes all membership user objects from the collection.
Copies the membership user collection to a one-dimensional array.

A one-dimensional array of type <xref href="System.Web.Security.MembershipUser"></xref> that is the destination of the elements copied from the <xref href="System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection"></xref>.
The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in the array at which copying begins.
Gets the number of membership user objects in the collection.
The number of <xref href="System.Web.Security.MembershipUser"></xref> objects in the collection.
Gets an enumerator that can iterate through the membership user collection.
Enumerators only allow reading the data in the collection.
Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
For more information, see <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator>.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> for the entire <xref href="System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the membership user collection is thread safe.
Application code does not normally use this property.
Always `false` because thread-safe membership user collections are not supported.
Gets the membership user in the collection referenced by the specified user name.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUser> object returned by <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection.Item%2A> property contains a snapshot of user information in the membership data store.
That is, changes to the membership user information in the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection> are not reflected in the membership data store.

To modify membership user information in the membership data store, use the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.UpdateUser%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.DeleteUser%2A> methods.
The <xref href="System.Web.Security.MembershipUser.UserName"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Web.Security.MembershipUser"></xref> to retrieve from the collection.
A object representing the user specified by name.
Removes the membership user object with the specified user name from the collection.
The user name of the <xref href="System.Web.Security.MembershipUser"></xref> object to remove from the collection.
The collection is read-only.
Makes the contents of the membership user collection read-only.
The contents of a <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection> are considered read-only, as they are a snapshot of the membership user information in the membership data store.

Membership user information is modified using the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.UpdateUser%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.DeleteUser%2A> methods.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection.SetReadOnly%2A> method marks the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection> as read-only so that <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUser> objects cannot be added to or removed from the collection.
Property values for the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUser> objects are not marked as read-only.

That is, you can modify the property values of a <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUser> in the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection> regardless of whether the collection has been marked as read-only by the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection.SetReadOnly%2A> method.
Gets the synchronization root.
Application code does not normally use this property.
Always `this`, because synchronization of membership user collections is not supported.

Copies the contents of the <xref href="System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection"></xref> object to an <xref href="System.Array"></xref>, starting at a particular <xref href="System.Array"></xref> index.
The one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that is the destination for the objects copied from the <xref href="System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Array"></xref> must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.
array is `null`.
index is less than 0.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
index is greater than or equal to the length of array.
-or-
The number of elements in the source is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.
The type of the source <xref href="System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection"></xref> cannot be cast automatically to the type of the destination array.
